str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have come, be present, have arrived. A primary verb; to arrive, i.e. Be present.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A thief. From klepto; a stealer.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and erchomai; to come near or aside, i.e. To approach, go by, perish or neglect, avert.
With a great noise, with a rushing sound. Adverb from a derivative of rhoizos; whizzingly, i.e. With a crash.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of stoicheo; something orderly in arrangement, i.e. a serial constituent, proposition.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: To burn with great heat. From kausis; to set on fire.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
